message.content:
Below is one systematic way to interpret and rebuild the two structures exactly as shown, using only the orientations provided in the “block dictionary” image.

──────────────────────────────────
1) DESCRIPTION OF THE TARGET IMAGE
──────────────────────────────────

● Left “I‐Shaped” Structure  
  – Block Count: 6 total  
    1. Top horizontal yellow plank  
    2. Bottom horizontal yellow plank  
    3. Left tall green rectangular block (vertical)  
    4. Right tall green rectangular block (vertical)  
    5. Red cube (in the upper center)  
    6. Blue cube (in the lower center)  

  – Layers & Arrangement:  
    • One yellow plank lies flat at the top; one lies flat at the bottom.  
    • Between them are three “columns”:  
      – A vertical green rectangular block on the far left (runs top to bottom),  
      – Two stacked cubes in the middle (red on top of blue),  
      – Another vertical green rectangular block on the far right.  

● Right “House” Structure  
  – Block Count: 8 total  
    1. Bottom row: green cube (left) and orange cube (right)  
    2. Second row: green cube (left) and orange cube (right)  
    3. Third row: two blue cubes side by side  
    4. Roof: two orange triangular blocks forming the pitched top  

  – Layers & Arrangement:  
    • The house is built in four layers.  
    • Layer 1 (bottom): 2 cubes wide (green, orange).  
    • Layer 2: another 2 cubes wide (green, orange).  
    • Layer 3: 2 blue cubes.  
    • Layer 4 (roof): a pair of orange triangular prisms meeting along the top.  


─────────────────────────────────────────
2) SELECTING THE REQUIRED DICTIONARY BLOCKS
─────────────────────────────────────────
Match each piece in color/shape/orientation exactly as shown in the dictionary:

● For the Left “I”:
  1) Yellow planks (horizontal) → use block index 9 (twice)  
     – #9 is the long yellow plank lying flat left‐to‐right.  
  2) Tall green rectangular blocks (vertical) → use block index 8 (twice)  
     – #8 is the green rectangle oriented upright.  
  3) Red cube → block index 4  
     – #4 is the red cube.  
  4) Blue cube → block index 1  
     – #1 is the blue cube.  

● For the Right “House”:
  1) Green cubes → block index 2 (twice)  
  2) Orange cubes → block index 3 (twice)  
  3) Blue cubes → block index 1 (twice more)  
  4) Orange triangular roof pieces → block indices 14 (left roof) and 16 (right roof)  


────────────────────────────────────
3) STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS
────────────────────────────────────
Below is one possible assembly order (json‐style). Note that the same index may appear multiple times:

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 9   // bottom yellow plank (I‐structure)
  Step2:  Move block with index 8   // left green upright (I‐structure)
  Step3:  Move block with index 8   // right green upright (I‐structure)
  Step4:  Move block with index 4   // red cube in center (I‐structure)
  Step5:  Move block with index 1   // blue cube in center (I‐structure)
  Step6:  Move block with index 9   // top yellow plank (I‐structure)

  Step7:  Move block with index 2   // bottom-left green cube (house)
  Step8:  Move block with index 3   // bottom-right orange cube (house)
  Step9:  Move block with index 2   // second-row left green cube (house)
  Step10: Move block with index 3   // second-row right orange cube (house)
  Step11: Move block with index 1   // third-row left blue cube (house)
  Step12: Move block with index 1   // third-row right blue cube (house)
  Step13: Move block with index 14  // left orange roof triangle (house)
  Step14: Move block with index 16  // right orange roof triangle (house)
}

That completes the reconstruction of both the “I‐shaped” frame on the left and the “house” on the right exactly as shown.
